note.p: Letter not found; text is a memorandum from Württemberg's Ministry of Church and School Affairs to Kurt Lampert, Director of Stuttgart's Staatliches Museum für Naturkunde. The signatory, Sarvey, who has not been further identified, was presumably an official in the Ministry. Silcher, as Minister, would have signed the letter sent to M.

p.seg: [Das Ministerium hat den Bericht vom 22. v. 3. d. Mts, betreffend den bevorstehenden 70. Geburtstag des Baron Dr Ferdinand v. Müller in Melbourne eingesehen und an denselben im Allerhöchsten Auftrag Seiner Majistät des Königs ein Glückwunschschreiben gerichtet, wovon die Direktion in Kenntniss gesetzt wird.

note.p: The letter's being sent was prompted by a memorandum from Lampert, 6 April 1895, alerting the Ministry of Church and School Affairs to the fact that M's 70th birthday was approaching and reminding them of his manifold contributions to the Museum's collections as well as his funding of a scholarship from which the collections had likewise benefited.

div.p: [The Ministry has accepted the report of 22nd of the previous month concerning the forthcoming 70th birthday of Baron Dr Ferdinand v. Müller in Melbourne and has addressed a letter of congratulations to him on behalf of His Majesty the King, of which the Directorate is informed.
